title: Migrants Take More Risky—and Sometimes Deadly—Paths to Illegally Enter U.S.
sub_head: Following border-wall expansion and faster removals to Mexico, migrants opt for remote mountain paths, boats and trains
body: Crossing into the U.S. illegally has gotten more difficult over the past year, leading more migrants to take treacherous and sometimes deadly paths as their numbers have grown substantially in recent months, border officials and aid groups say.
